{"step_by_step_thinking": "The zygomatic arch is a bony structure on the side of the skull, and it's made up of two parts: the temporal process of the zygomatic bone and the zygomatic process of the temporal bone. These two parts meet at the zygomaticotemporal suture. Fractures of the zygomatic arch most commonly occur at the weakest point, which is the suture where the two parts meet.", "answer_choice": "A"}
